data.description: Schweitzer Engineering Laboratories (SEL) seeks professional, innovative, and detail-oriented individuals for Software Engineering Internships. We are looking for someone who will be able to work part-time during the school year and full-time during the summer in our Spokane Valley, WA office. If you are a current student looking for an opportunity to develop your software engineering skills, learn from industry leading engineers, and enhance your academic learning, then this may be the position for you!A typical day as a Software Engineering Intern might include the following: Providing support to SEL engineers and customers.Supporting SEL’s software development processes.Verifying software meets requirements, documenting and communication test results.Performing testing on new and existing technologies.Embracing the mindset: Understand. Create. Simplify.Applying SEL Values, Principles of Operations, and World Class Manufacturing Principles.Performing other duties as assigned.This job might be for you if:You are a current student pursuing a degree in computer science or equivalent degree with at least one year of technical coursework completedYou have the ability to learn new skills and assume new responsibilitiesYou have programming experience Python and OO programming languages and experience using a variety of scripting languagesYou have the ability to execute and document defined testing proceduresYou have strong writing, documentation, and speaking skillsYou have the ability and passion to work cooperatively in a team environmentYou have practical knowledge of developing Microsoft Windows applicationsYou have knowledge of SQL and database conceptsYou have experience using revision control and source code management systems such as Git, Mercurial, SVN, and Rational ClearCaseLocation Information: Spokane Valley, WAAll SEL internships are 100% onsite. This position is based in our Spokane Valley, WA office where you are minutes from a vast array of outdoor activities to enjoy. Beautiful lakes, rivers, and mountains with dozens of hiking trails and miles of biking trails to choose from. A small-town feel, but just minutes from downtown entertainment, dining and shopping in both Spokane, WA and nearby Coeur d'Alene, ID. The perfect place to live if you want the best of both worlds -- small town feel with a little city. ​Competitive pay. Superior benefits. Inspiring work.People are at the core of our company and we hire employee-owners. We welcome you to learn more about how we support our interns.Pay Range Data ($19.50 - $29.50 per hour) - Our intern pay is determined based on the internship role (the work you would be doing) and your year in school (when you plan to graduate). Talk to your recruiter if you are curious about the rate for your year in school.School matters. SEL managers work with their interns to arrange flexible schedules that accommodate classes and studying while working part-time during the school year.We challenge and rely on our interns to contribute high-quality work that adds value to our company and gives you an advantage with real-world experiences when seeking jobs after graduation.We aim to bring great talent to SEL and although not guaranteed, interns are frequently hired for full-time roles upon graduation.Ask our team about other intern benefits including wellness resources, community connection, and kickstarting retirement savings.Communication with Applicants We communicate with all applicants. If you do not receive a response about your application, please check your SPAM filter or reach out to us at internships@selinc.com.SEL is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Vets/Disabled.#SEL25
requirements: Verifying software meets requirements, documenting and communication test results.
You are a current student pursuing a degree in computer science or equivalent degree with at least one year of technical coursework completed

Pay Range Data ($19.50 - $29.50 per hour) - Our intern pay is determined based on the internship role (the work you would be doing) and your year in school (when you plan to graduate). Talk to your recruiter if you are curious about the rate for your year in school.
School matters. SEL managers work with their interns to arrange flexible schedules that accommodate classes and studying while working part-time during the school year.
responsibilities: You have the ability to learn new skills and assume new responsibilities
